column4: I am trying to get my rtl8180 wifi card to work in ubuntu, I had it working fine in debian but can't get it to work here... I think it is due to the driver... now the driver I found, but I don't know how to get it from the cvs repository.  can anyone help me?
I did that, but it is not working
I googled, that is how I got it working in debian
they have a linux driver that is open source, but I need to get the cvs version to let it work with this .12 kernal
can someone help me get that file
i'm having problems getting my video-out pci card to work
the driver I used with the 2.6.9 kernel does not work with the ubuntu kernel
but like I was saying, I have had the driver working before I know exaclty where to get the driver for it all to work again... but
I don't know how to download the flipping cvs, I have tried all the howtos and it gives me just errors
anyone use a tview pci scan converter card on linux?
I think I have told you that before
